messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Patel, Rakesh" <rakesh.patel@m...>
wrote:
> Hi,
>
> what is the best way to verify database updates in the db? I really
do not
> want to write jdbc code in the the JUnit cases if i can avoid it.
>
> We got round the issue of running specific sql scripts in the
> setUp()/tearDown() methods by calling Ant programmatically with a
buildfile
> containing the required code. Works really well and means we can
use Ant
> functionality in our test cases.
>
> Thanks
>
> Rakesh

Hi Rakesh,

I suggest you to look at DbUnit (http://www.dbunit.org). This is a
JUnit extension that puts your database into a known state between
test runs. DbUnit also provides assert facility to verify that your
database content match some expected values.

Cheers,

Manuel Laflamme
